main event: Multiple sightings of brilliant red flashing objects were reported on November 7, 1957, in Bowling Green, Ohio.
interesting points: The objects were described as bright silver and round in shape, approximately 35 degrees with the horizon, and then turned to a brilliant silvery-white color as they moved upward.
The lights emitted by the objects were much brighter than the sun and similar to lightning flashes, lasting for a definite period of time with no specific interval between flashes.
The witnesses, including an Air Science Cadet and Mr. Bosu, provided detailed descriptions of the objects' movements and observed them for several minutes.
No photographs were taken of the objects despite the multiple sightings, which adds to the mystery of the reported phenomena.

The report submitted to the Air Defense Command at Ent Air Force Base concluded that the specific description, maneuvers, and characteristics of the objects were similar to hundreds of reports of balloons observed near dawn or dusk.
